instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U4900: What is U4900? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in older(pre-2013) macbooks.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC: What is SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC? SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC is a voltage that is created if SMC_BC_ACOK & PP3V42_G3H are both present that powers the chipset for the onewire circuit that allows the SMC to talk to the charger on the SYS_ONEWIRE line. This is necessary for the magsafe charger to have a light on it. .
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.5V_S5: What is 5V_S5? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S5” which is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bad smc?
threads.message:
Hi Guys ,
I received that 3115 board not turning ON with no history, very clean no apparent water damage

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>: 12.59V
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>: 3.493V
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>: not stable : 3.33V to 3.49v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>: not stable pulsing between 3.5v to 5.0v
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>: pulsing

At <CHIP>U6901</CHIP>:
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>: 3.353V
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC</SIGNAL>: 3.493V

At <CHIP>U6900</CHIP>:
<SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL>: 3.472V

Suspecting <CHIP>U4900</CHIP> SMC

Put flux and reheated without success.

Anything else to check before reballing SMC?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bad smc?
threads.message: do you get green light on charger? if yes then your smc is fine(i think it should be fine as ppbus is 12.59 volts

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bad smc?
threads.message: I had the green light , but went after reheating the SMC

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bad smc?
threads.message: Try reflowing it again with good flux

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bad smc?
threads.message: If went bad after reflow, remove SMC and reball it now...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bad smc?
threads.message:
Reballed SMC ( Nighmare job ), and put it back:
Now I'm back were it was:

green Light OK
Pulsing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>: pulsing

At <CHIP>U6901</CHIP>:
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>: 3.350V
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK_VCC</SIGNAL>: 3.492V

At <CHIP>U6900</CHIP>:
<SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL>: 3.470V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bad smc?
threads.message: I'll have to re do the job with another smc.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bad smc?
threads.message:
Chek if <SIGNAL>5V_SUS</SIGNAL> pulses too, or is short to ground.
Also remove <RESISTOR>R5805</RESISTOR> and see if get stable <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL>.
No pulse at all at L7260?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bad smc?
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>5V_SUS</SIGNAL> also pulses,
Removed <RESISTOR>R5805</RESISTOR>, <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL> still pulsing
very light pulses at  L7260 from 0V to max 0.04V
Also my DC power supply is "tic-ing" in loop but doesn't go in protection mode (CC)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bad smc?
threads.message:
Possibly SMC detects something and pull down <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>.
Try SMC bypass...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bad smc?
threads.message:
Already tried at the begining and no sign of life

Also removed both <TRANSISTOR>Q7840</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U7801</CHIP> and checked but i'ts still pulsing

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bad smc?
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bad smc?
